instructions.1: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
instructions.2: Place sausage in a baking dish and cook, rotating every 5 minutes, until no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read 160 degrees F (70 degrees C). Cool to room temperature and slice. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
instructions.3: Place naan bread on a baking sheet; spread marinara sauce over naan and top with mozzarella cheese. Layer sliced sausage on top of cheese and spread onion and bell pepper slices over the sausage. Sprinkle Cajun seasoning over the top.
instructions.4: Bake in the oven until cheese is melted and toppings are hot, about 10 minutes. Let rest for 5 minutes before slicing.

questions.question: In Step 3, is the sausage from Step 2 being used?
Is sausage from Step 2 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is cajun seasoning from Step 3 still available in Step 4?
Is oven's broiler live after Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 2?
If we skip Step 2, is it still valid to layer the sausage in Step 3?
Can we place (Step 3) and bake (Step 4) at the same time?
